alert.note: Alert for Crosby (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 9:23AM CDT until May 29 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Texas, including the following counties, Crosby, Lubbock and Lynn. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 923 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lubbock, Slaton, Tahoka, Crosbyton, White River Lake, Idalou, Ralls, Lorenzo, Ransom Canyon, O`Donnell, Kalgary, Caprock, Woodrow, Grassland, Downtown Lubbock, Lubbock International Airport, Texas Tech University, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Cone and New Moore. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
